title: Notes of a ramble through France, Italy, Switzerland, Germany, Holland, and Belgium;
snippet: Our path still lay near the bank of theriver through a shady wood here and there enlivened with little rustic seats and summer-houses. The Bonnington Linn situated at an angle of thestream, and descending in an unbroken sheet froma height of twenty-seven feet only, forms a pleasing object, but does not display those grand accompaniments which characterize the noble fallbelow. The river is here divided in its course,and produces a second cataract of a smaUer size.
